availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Blackwell. Father of Nancy Blackwell, Prissie Blackwell, Thomas Blackwell, Matilda Blackwell, and Joseph Blackwell. Farmer in Union County, Kentucky, in 1850. Merchant in Webster County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Webster County in 1860. Merchant in Webster County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 467A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 554-55.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 483A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Webster County, KY, June 1863, p. 2.
"Joel Blackwell (1825-1891)," Find A Grave, Memorial #41182147, accessed November 10, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41182147.
